page.title: 10NEWTON FIELD CENTRE
page.content: Newton Field Centre is located in the abandoned Church of St. Faiths. In 1975 a kitchen, office, library, laboratory and toilets were installed and a second floor was built to accommodate dormitories. About 40 schools from Northamptonshire attend the Centre to study about 30 subjects under the headings of Ecology, Conservation and Natural History. 15 schools stay overnight. The Centre costs 25,000 pounds per year to run. The wardens would like to provide more laboratory space and equipment. They think it is essential that no more of the wildlife habitats, used for study, are destroyed. The local farmers are helpful and pleased with the Centre. Since it opened vandalism has been reduced in the area.
